channel.title: Road to Quest Point Cape
channel.description:
I've been playing RS for many years and after seeing [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=355008]Mihalich[/url] getting a max cape, I decided to actually do something on my account since it has been years since my last 3 99s. I will update this periodically as I finish a quest or complete a skill goal. Positive feedback and support from the community will keep me going.
Combat Level: 162 Quest points: 284/343
[size=6]Skill Requirements:[/size] * = Achieved since thread was made
Agility - 99/77 Attack - 82/78 Constitution - 99/76 Construction - 55/70 Cooking - 70/70* Crafting - 61/76 Defence - 80/80 Dungeoneering - 65/50 Farming - 55/65 Firemaking - 78/74 Fishing - 72/70 Fletching - 54/70 Herblore - 56/65 Hunter - 59/67 Magic - 75/80 Mining - 61/76 Prayer - 71/70 Ranged - 63/75 Runecrafting - 69/61 Slayer - 54/67 Smithing - 54/80 Strength - 80/78 Summoning - 58/65 Thieving - 60/74 Woodcutting - 99/76
[size=6]Quest Requirements:[/size]
(RED - Not started) (BLUE - Started)
Back to my Roots Blood Runs Deep Branches of Darkmeyer, The Brink of Extinction, The Clockwork Syringe, A Contact! Curse of Arrav, The Darkness of Hallowvale Deadliest Catch Dealing with Scabaras Devious Minds Do No Evil Dream Mentor Elder Kiln, The In Aid of the Myreque King of the Dwarves Legacy of Seergaze Love Story Mourning's Ends - Part 1 Mourning's Ends - Part 2 My Arm's Big Adventure Nomad's Requiem Path of Glouphrie, The Prisoner of Glouphrie, The Ritual of the Mahjarrat Rocking Out Temple at Senntisten, The TokTz-Ket-Dill Void Dance, A Void Stares Back, The While Guthix Sleeps Within The Light Wolf Whistle World Wakes, The
There isn't a ton left to do (really, the hard part is the skilling) and I have a love for quests so this should be fun for me.
I'd absolutely love it if you guys gave me tips on skilling or certain quest bosses etc, since most of the info is outdated online.
I'd also really appreciate it if some of you could LEND me weapons for defeating the bosses, since my weapons absolutely suck (this is the first time I got back into RS after the EOC update, and whips absolutely suck now).
Another note, if anyone wants to skill with me or just talk to me, my RSN is [b]Battla Masta[/b].

item.title: Road to Quest Point Cape
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“mihalich, post:10, topic:528368”]Good luck man, working on mine currently also :)[/quote]Thanks. Good luck to you too, although you don’t have to go through the training like I do.

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:11, topic:528368”]I’ve had mine since like 2010 and it’s easy to keep once you have it. I just can’t wear it right now because I have 342/343 quests points because I’m f2p for now.[/quote]Ah, that stinks.

Read full topic

item.title: Road to Quest Point Cape
item.dc:creator: @mihalich mihalich
item.description:
@mihalich wrote:

Good luck man, working on mine currently also

Read full topic

item.title: Road to Quest Point Cape
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

I will either do cannonballs or continue superheating. I’m leaning towards the superheating, because it’s really good for the money and I not only get smithing XP, but a ton of magic xp, even though by that time I would already be past my magic goal, which is 80.

Read full topic

item.title: Road to Quest Point Cape
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

If you wish to make a small profit:

-cannonballs
-adamant arrows/bolts(unf)
-goldsmithing with superheat/gaunts ( about 60k+ xp/hour if done right)

http://www.zybez.net/guides/516/smithing/

http://forums.zybez.net/topic/1532571-the-ultimate-smithing-guide-to-99-with-artisans-workshop-mini-guide/

http://forums.zybez.net/topic/1211174-superheating-guide-new-content-added-skyeam/

Read full topic

item.title: Road to Quest Point Cape
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:6, topic:528368”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=647119.msg4352567#msg4352567 date=1376929568]

I had a 65m budget to do this, and I already blew through 5m to superheat gold into gold bars. This will get me 80 mage and a much higher smithing, and from there I will probably do the Artisan’s Workshop, though I have no idea what to do there or how much it will take to get 80 smithing.

Artisan’s Workshop absolutely blows your money, but it is fast xp depending on which bars you use.
[/quote]^ yeah what he said but luckily for you I believe you could stay below 65m for 54-80 smithing.

Another option (and what I personally did before I met Kieran xD…) was make cannonballs. The experience was quite slow but with Mor tasks done for the legs the speed is quite feasible.[/quote]I meant I have 65m to get all my skills up to get the quest cape, not just smithing.

So I should make cannonballs or?

Read full topic

item.title: Road to Quest Point Cape
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:5, topic:528368”][quote author=Travas link=topic=647119.msg4352559#msg4352559 date=1376927780]
I had a 65m budget to do this, and I already blew through 5m to superheat gold into gold bars. This will get me 80 mage and a much higher smithing, and from there I will probably do the Artisan’s Workshop, though I have no idea what to do there or how much it will take to get 80 smithing.
[/quote]
Artisan’s Workshop absolutely blows your money, but it is fast xp depending on which bars you use.[/quote]^ yeah what he said but luckily for you I believe you could stay below 65m for 54-80 smithing.

Another option (and what I personally did before I met Kieran xD…) was make cannonballs. The experience was quite slow but with Mor tasks done for the legs the speed is quite feasible.

Read full topic

item.title: Road to Quest Point Cape
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Travas:

I had a 65m budget to do this, and I already blew through 5m to superheat gold into gold bars. This will get me 80 mage and a much higher smithing, and from there I will probably do the Artisan’s Workshop, though I have no idea what to do there or how much it will take to get 80 smithing.

Artisan’s Workshop absolutely blows your money, but it is fast xp depending on which bars you use.

Read full topic

item.title: Road to Quest Point Cape
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:2, topic:528368”]If you’re into the God/mahjarrat lure, you will love WGS (While Guthix Sleeps), RoTM (Ritual of The Mahjarrat), and TWW (The World Wakes). But a requirement for TWW should have been the completion of WGS for it to make sense to the people who haven’t done WGS and have done TWW.[/quote]I will do TWW absolutely last, which is why I haven’t finished it.

[quote=“Mikeyzzz, post:3, topic:528368”]Good luck with this, keep us updated and post pictures to make it more appealing.[/quote]Thank you, will do.

I had a 65m budget to do this, and I already blew through 5m to superheat gold into gold bars. This will get me 80 mage and a much higher smithing, and from there I will probably do the Artisan’s Workshop, though I have no idea what to do there or how much it will take to get 80 smithing.

Read full topic

item.title: Road to Quest Point Cape
item.dc:creator: @Mikeyzzz Mikeyzzz
item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

Good luck with this, keep us updated and post pictures to make it more appealing.

item.title: Road to Quest Point Cape
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

If you’re into the God/mahjarrat lure, you will love WGS (While Guthix Sleeps), RoTM (Ritual of The Mahjarrat), and TWW (The World Wakes). But a requirement for TWW should have been the completion of WGS for it to make sense to the people who haven’t done WGS and have done TWW.

Read full topic
